```{r}
head(Cloak,3)
```


```{r}
# 2 draw boxplot of the Invisibility data:
library(tidyverse)
ggplot(Cloak, aes(x=Group, y=Mischief)) + geom_boxplot();
```
```{r}
# 3 draw a histogram of the Invisibility data use facet_wrap(~ Group):

ggplot(Cloak, aes(x=Mischief)) + geom_histogram( fill="Purple", color="black", breaks = seq(0,8, by=1)) + facet_grid(~Group)

```
```{r}
# 5 create a t-test of Mischief by Group using invisibility data:
library(psych)
ind.t.test<-t.test(Mischief~Group, data = Cloak)

ind.t.test


```


On average, participants experienced greater mischief (M = 5.00), than who are not cloak (M = 3.5). This difference was not significant, t(21.541) = âˆ’1.7135, p = 0.101.
